docs.title: What is AlmaSEO?
docs.text: AlmaSEO is an AI-powered WordPress plugin that automatically generates high-quality, SEO-optimized content for your website. It uses advanced natural language processing to create engaging articles, blog posts, and web content that ranks well in search engines.

docs.title: How does AlmaSEO work?
docs.text: AlmaSEO connects to your WordPress site and uses AI technology to: - Generate original content based on your topics and keywords - Optimize content for search engines automatically - Create internal links between related articles - Schedule and publish content on your behalf - Provide analytics and performance tracking

docs.title: Is AlmaSEO compatible with my WordPress site?
docs.text: AlmaSEO is compatible with: - WordPress 5.0 or higher - PHP 7.4 or higher - Most WordPress themes - Popular SEO plugins (Yoast, RankMath, etc.) - All major hosting providers

docs.title: How do I install AlmaSEO?
docs.text:
You can install AlmaSEO in two ways: 1. WordPress Admin: Go to Plugins → Add New, search for "AlmaSEO" 2. Manual Upload: Download the plugin and upload via FTP

See our Installation Guide for detailed steps.

docs.title: Do I need an API key?
docs.text: Yes, you'll need an AlmaSEO API key to use the plugin. You can get one by: 1. Creating an account on our website 2. Purchasing a subscription plan 3. Receiving your unique API key

docs.title: How do I configure my API key?
docs.text:
1. Go to AlmaSEO → Settings
  2. Click on API Configuration
  3. Enter your API key
  4. Click Save Settings
  5. Test the connection to verify it's working

docs.title: What if my API connection fails?
docs.text: Common causes and solutions: - Incorrect API key: Double-check your key - Internet connection: Ensure stable internet - Hosting restrictions: Contact your hosting provider - Firewall issues: Check server firewall settings

docs.title: How long does it take to generate content?
docs.text: Content generation typically takes 30-60 seconds per article, depending on: - Article length (300-2000 words) - Complexity of the topic - Current server load - Your internet connection speed

docs.title: Can I edit the generated content?
docs.text: Absolutely! All generated content is fully editable. You can: - Modify any text directly in the editor - Add your own insights and experiences - Adjust tone and style - Include additional media and links

docs.title: What content types can AlmaSEO generate?
docs.text: AlmaSEO can generate: - Blog posts and articles - Product descriptions - Landing page content - FAQ pages - Meta descriptions and titles - Social media posts - Email newsletters

docs.title: How does AlmaSEO ensure content quality?
docs.text: AlmaSEO uses multiple quality assurance measures: - Advanced AI models trained on high-quality content - Built-in plagiarism detection - SEO optimization algorithms - Readability scoring - Grammar and style checking

docs.title: Does AlmaSEO automatically optimize for SEO?
docs.text: Yes! AlmaSEO automatically: - Incorporates target keywords naturally - Creates proper heading structures (H1, H2, H3) - Generates meta descriptions and titles - Suggests internal linking opportunities - Optimizes for readability and user engagement

docs.title: Can I use AlmaSEO with other SEO plugins?
docs.text: Yes, AlmaSEO works well with popular SEO plugins like: - Yoast SEO - RankMath - All in One SEO - SEOPress - The SEO Framework

docs.title: How does AlmaSEO handle keywords?
docs.text: AlmaSEO intelligently integrates keywords by: - Using them naturally throughout the content - Maintaining optimal keyword density - Including them in headings and meta tags - Creating variations and related terms - Avoiding keyword stuffing

docs.title: Does AlmaSEO create duplicate content?
docs.text: No, AlmaSEO generates unique, original content for each request. The AI creates fresh content based on your topics and keywords, ensuring no duplicate content issues.

docs.title: How much does AlmaSEO cost?
docs.text:
AlmaSEO offers several subscription plans: - Starter: $29/month (50 articles) - Professional: $79/month (200 articles) - Enterprise: $199/month (unlimited articles)

All plans include full features and support.

docs.title: What happens if I exceed my monthly limit?
docs.text: You'll receive a notification when approaching your limit. You can: - Upgrade your plan for more articles - Wait until your next billing cycle - Purchase additional article credits

docs.title: Is there a free trial?
docs.text: Yes! We offer a 7-day free trial with: - 10 free articles - Full feature access - No credit card required - Easy cancellation

docs.title: Can I cancel my subscription anytime?
docs.text: Yes, you can cancel your subscription at any time: - No long-term contracts - No cancellation fees - Access continues until the end of your billing period - Easy cancellation through your account dashboard

docs.title: What if I encounter an error?
docs.text: If you encounter issues: 1. Check our documentation for common solutions 2. Review error logs in AlmaSEO settings 3. Contact support at support@almaseo.com 4. Include error details for faster resolution

docs.title: How do I get technical support?
docs.text: We offer multiple support channels: - Email Support: support@almaseo.com - Live Chat: Available on our website - Documentation: Comprehensive guides and tutorials - Community Forum: Connect with other users

docs.title: What information should I include when contacting support?
docs.text: Please include: - Your WordPress version - PHP version - AlmaSEO version - Error message or description - Steps to reproduce the issue - Screenshots if applicable

docs.title: How can I track my content performance?
docs.text: AlmaSEO provides comprehensive analytics: - Engagement metrics: Page views, time on page - SEO performance: Rankings, organic traffic - Content quality scores: Readability and optimization - ROI tracking: Cost per article and conversions

docs.title: Can I export my analytics data?
docs.text: Yes, you can export analytics data in multiple formats: - CSV files for spreadsheet analysis - PDF reports for presentations - API access for custom integrations - Scheduled reports via email

docs.title: How does AlmaSEO affect my site's performance?
docs.text: AlmaSEO is designed to be lightweight: - Minimal impact on page load speed - Efficient API calls - Optimized database queries - Caching for improved performance

docs.title: Is my content secure?
docs.text: Yes, AlmaSEO prioritizes security: - All API communications are encrypted - No content is stored on external servers - Your WordPress credentials are never shared - Regular security updates and patches

docs.title: Does AlmaSEO store my content?
docs.text:
AlmaSEO only stores: - Your API key (encrypted) - Basic usage statistics - Your content preferences

Your actual content remains on your WordPress site.

docs.title: Is AlmaSEO GDPR compliant?
docs.text: Yes, AlmaSEO is fully GDPR compliant: - Clear data processing information - User consent mechanisms - Right to data deletion - Secure data handling practices

docs.title: Can I use AlmaSEO for multiple websites?
docs.text: Yes! You can use AlmaSEO on multiple websites: - Each site needs its own WordPress installation - API key works across all your sites - Separate analytics for each site - Bulk management capabilities

docs.title: Does AlmaSEO support multiple languages?
docs.text: Currently, AlmaSEO supports: - English (primary) - Spanish - French - German - Additional languages coming soon

docs.title: Can I integrate AlmaSEO with other tools?
docs.text: Yes, AlmaSEO offers various integrations: - Social Media: Auto-post to platforms - Email Marketing: Newsletter integration - CRM Systems: Customer data integration - Analytics Tools: Google Analytics, etc. - API Access: Custom integrations

docs.title: Does AlmaSEO support team collaboration?
docs.text: Yes, AlmaSEO supports team features: - Multiple user accounts - Role-based permissions - Content approval workflows - Team analytics and reporting - Shared templates and settings

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing AlmaSEO, ensure your WordPress site meets these requirements:

  • WordPress Version: 5.0 or higher
  • PHP Version: 7.4 or higher
  • Memory Limit: 256MB minimum (512MB recommended)
  • Active Theme: Any WordPress theme
  • Plugin Compatibility: Compatible with most SEO plugins

docs.title: Method 1: WordPress Admin (Recommended)
docs.text:
1. Log into WordPress Admin
  2. Navigate to your WordPress dashboard

  3. Go to Plugins → Add New

  4. Search for AlmaSEO

  5. In the search box, type "AlmaSEO"
  6. Look for "AlmaSEO - AI Content Generator"

  7. Click Install Now

  8. Activate the Plugin

  9. After installation, click Activate
  10. You'll see a new "AlmaSEO" menu in your admin sidebar

docs.title: Method 2: Manual Upload
docs.text:
1. Download the Plugin
  2. Download the AlmaSEO plugin ZIP file

  3. Extract the contents to a folder

  4. Upload via FTP

  5. Connect to your server via FTP
  6. Navigate to /wp-content/plugins/

  7. Upload the almaseo folder

  8. Activate in WordPress

  9. Go to Plugins in your WordPress admin
  10. Find "AlmaSEO" and click Activate

docs.title: 1. API Key Configuration
docs.text:
After activation, you'll need to configure your API key:

  1. Navigate to AlmaSEO Settings
  2. Go to AlmaSEO → Settings

  3. Click on the API Configuration tab

  4. Enter Your API Key

  5. Paste your AlmaSEO API key
  6. Click Save Settings

docs.title: 2. Site Verification
docs.text:
1. Test Connection
  2. Click Test Connection to verify your setup

  3. Ensure all systems are communicating properly

  4. Verify Permissions

  5. Check that AlmaSEO has proper permissions
  6. Ensure your hosting environment supports the required features

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: To ensure smooth operation of the AlmaSEO application without interference from ModSecurity or other security measures, you need to whitelist the application's IP address on your server.

docs.title: Why IP Whitelisting is Necessary
docs.text:
• ModSecurity Bypass: Prevents false positives from ModSecurity rules
  • Rate Limiting: Avoids rate limiting restrictions
  • Security Headers: Bypasses certain security header checks
  • Smooth Operation: Ensures uninterrupted API calls and data processing

docs.title: Current IP Address
docs.text:
Primary IP Address: [YOUR_SERVER_IP]

Note: Replace [YOUR_SERVER_IP] with your actual server IP address.

docs.title: Method 1: Apache Configuration (Recommended)
docs.text:
Add the following to your Apache configuration or .htaccess file:

# IP Whitelisting for AlmaSEO
<IfModule mod_security.c>
    SecRule REMOTE_ADDR "@ipMatch [YOUR_SERVER_IP]" "id:1000,phase:1,pass,nolog,ctl:ruleEngine=Off"
</IfModule>

# Alternative method for specific paths
<Location "/api/">
    <IfModule mod_security.c>
        SecRule REMOTE_ADDR "@ipMatch [YOUR_SERVER_IP]" "id:1001,phase:1,pass,nolog,ctl:ruleEngine=Off"
    </IfModule>
</Location>

docs.title: Method 2: Nginx Configuration
docs.text:
If using Nginx, add to your server block:

# IP Whitelisting for AlmaSEO
location / {
    # Allow specific IP
    allow [YOUR_SERVER_IP];
    deny all;

    # Your existing configuration here
    proxy_pass http://backend;
    # ... other directives
}

docs.title: Method 3: Cloudflare Configuration
docs.text:
If using Cloudflare, you can whitelist the IP in the Cloudflare dashboard:

  1. Go to Security → WAF
  2. Add a custom rule to allow your server IP
  3. Set the rule to "Allow" for the specific IP address

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
After implementing the whitelist, verify it's working by:

  1. Check Logs: Monitor your server logs for any blocked requests
  2. Test API Calls: Make test API calls to ensure they're not being blocked
  3. Monitor Performance: Ensure smooth operation without security interruptions

docs.title: Security Considerations
docs.text:
• Keep IP Updated: If your server IP changes, update the whitelist immediately
  • Monitor Access: Regularly check server logs for any unauthorized access attempts
  • Backup Configuration: Keep backups of your configuration files
  • Documentation: Maintain clear documentation of all whitelisted IPs

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
1. Still Getting Blocked: Ensure the IP address is correct and the configuration is properly loaded
  2. Configuration Not Applied: Restart your web server after making changes
  3. Multiple IPs: If you have multiple server IPs, add them all to the whitelist

docs.title: Testing Commands
docs.text:
# Test if your IP is being blocked
curl -I https://yourdomain.com/api/test

# Check server logs for ModSecurity activity
tail -f /var/log/apache2/error.log | grep ModSecurity

docs.text:

  1. Check your server's error logs
  2. Verify the IP address is correct
  3. Ensure the configuration syntax is valid
  4. Contact support if problems persist
